alert.note: Alert for Daviess (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 26 at 9:19PM EST until March 05 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Kentucky...Illinois...Missouri... Ohio River at Owensboro, Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown, Golconda, Smithland Dam, Paducah, Olmsted Lock and Dam, and Cairo .Water levels continue to rise along the Ohio River from Owensboro to Cairo. Crests in minor to moderate flood stage are forecast to occur around the middle to end of next week. For the Ohio River...including Owensboro, Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown, Golconda, Smithland Dam, Paducah, Olmsted Lock and Dam, and Cairo...Minor to moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Owensboro. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:04 AM CST Saturday the stage was 39.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 41.0 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage next weekend. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
